objects.name: Practice
objects.description: Practice in the real environment. Sharpen Response Actions within your organization

objects.name: Take trainings
objects.description: Take training courses to gain relevant knowledge

objects.name: Raise personnel awareness
objects.description: Raise personnel awareness regarding phishing, ransomware, social engineering,  and other attacks that involve user interaction

objects.name: Make personnel report suspicious activity
objects.description: Make sure that personnel will report suspicious activity i.e. suspicious emails,  links, files, activity on their computers, etc

objects.name: Set up relevant data collection
objects.description: Usually, data collection is managed by Log Management/Security Monitoring/Threat Detection teams.  You need to provide them with a list of data that is critically important for IR process. Most of  the time, data like DNS and DHCP logs are not being collected, as their value for detection is  relatively low. You can refer to the existing Response Actions (Preparation stage) to develop the list

objects.name: Set up a centralized long-term log storage
objects.description: Set up a centralized long-term log storage. This is one of the most critical problems companies have nowadays. Even if there is such a system, in most of the cases it stores irrelevant data or has too small retention period

objects.name: Develop communication map
objects.description: Develop a communication map for both internal (C-level, managers and technical specialists from the other departments, that could be involved in IR process) and external communications (law enforcement, national CERTs, subject matter experts that you have lack of, etc)

objects.name: Make sure there are backups
objects.description: Make sure there are both online and offline backups. Make sure they are fully operational. In the case of a successful ransomware worm attack, thats the only thing that will help you to safe your critically important data

objects.name: Get network architecture map
objects.description: Get network architecture map. Usually, its managed by the Network security team. It will help you to choose the containment strategy, such as isolating specific network segments

objects.name: Get access control matrix
objects.description: Get Access Control Matrix. Usually, its managed by the Network security team. It will help you to identify adversary opportunities, such as laterally movement and so on

objects.name: Develop assets knowledge base
objects.description: Develop assets knowledge base. It will help you to compare observed activity with a normal activity profile for a specific host, user or network segment

objects.name: Check analysis toolset
objects.description: Make sure your toolset for analysis and management is updated and fully operational. Make sure that all the required permissions have been granted as well

objects.name: Access vulnerability management system logs
objects.description: Access vulnerability management system logs. It will help to identify the vulnerabilities a specific host had at a specific time in the past

objects.name: Connect with trusted communities
objects.description: Connect with trusted communities for information exchange

objects.name: Access external network flow logs
objects.description: Make sure you have access to external communication Network Flow logs

objects.name: Access internal network flow logs
objects.description: Make sure you have access to internal communication Network Flow logs

objects.description: Make sure you have access to internal communication HTTP logs

objects.description: Make sure you have access to DHCP logs

objects.description: Make sure you have access to internal communication Packet Capture data

objects.name: Access external packet capture data
objects.description: Make sure you have access to external communication Packet Capture data

objects.description: Make sure you have the ability to block an external IP address from being accessed by corporate assets
